… = data not available; * = provisional, preliminary, estimate; | = marks break in series; 0.0 = magnitude is less than half of the unit employed; − = magnitude equals zero; $ = United States dollars; cif = cost, insurance, and freight; fob = free on board; GDP = gross domestic product; GNI = gross national income; IMF = International Monetary Fund; km2 = square kilometer;  kWh = kilowatt-hour; L = liter; NPISHs = nonprofit institutions serving households; SDRs = special drawing rights; Vt = vatu.
For 2000 and 2001, includes wholesale and retail trade repair of motor vehicles; and other wholesale trade and retail trade.
For 2000 and 2001, includes information and communication.

For 2000 and 2001, includes accommodation and food services; real estate, professional, scientific, technical, and administrative services; and education, health, recreation, and other services. For 2002–2017, includes only education, health, and recreation.
Derived from national savings, net factor income from abroad, and net current transfers from abroad.
For 2006 and 2007, includes transport and communication.
For 2006 and 2007, includes health, education, and recreation and culture.
Excludes deposits of the Government of Vanuatu, but includes deposits of nonreporting (i.e., exempt) banks and other institutions held with reporting banks.
Includes claims on nonfinancial public enterprises.
Refers to claims of domestic commercial banks on private sector.
Exports include re-exports, while imports include importation of re-exports.
For 2011 onward, data are based on the IMF’s Balance of Payments and International Investment Position Manual (sixth edition).
